001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import squidpony.squidmath.Arrangement;
004import squidpony.squidmath.CrossHash;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007
008/**
009 * Customized storage of multiple types of 2D data, accessible by String (or CharSequence) keys.
010 * Meant for cases where SquidLib needs to produce a grid with multiple types of data, such as what could be represented
011 * by a 2D array of objects containing only char, int, double, and/or float data, but this is much more memory-efficient
012 * than producing many objects. This can be seen as a "struct-of-array" approach, to use C terminology, rather than an
013 * "array-of-struct" approach. This also allows new 2D arrays to be added to an existing GridData if needed.
014 */
015public class GridData {
016    public Arrangement<CharSequence> names;
017    public ArrayList<char[][]> charMaps;
018    public ArrayList<int[][]> intMaps;
019    public ArrayList<double[][]> doubleMaps;
020    public ArrayList<float[][]> floatMaps;
021
022    public GridData()
023    {
024        this(16);
025    }
026    public GridData(int expectedSize)
027    {
028        names = new Arrangement<>(expectedSize, CrossHash.stringHasher);
029        charMaps = new ArrayList<>(expectedSize);
030        intMaps = new ArrayList<>(expectedSize);
031        doubleMaps = new ArrayList<>(expectedSize);
032        floatMaps = new ArrayList<>(expectedSize);
033    }
034    public boolean contains(CharSequence item)
035    {
036        return names.containsKey(item);
037    }
038    public int indexOf(CharSequence item)
039    {
040        return names.getInt(item);
041    }
042    public char[][] getChars(CharSequence item)
043    {
044        int i = names.getInt(item);
045        char[][] d = null;
046        if(i >= 0 && i < charMaps.size())
047        {
048            d = charMaps.get(i);
049        }
050        return d;
051    }
052
053    public char[][] getChars(int index)
054    {
055        char[][] d = null;
056        if(index >= 0 && index < charMaps.size())
057        {
058            d = charMaps.get(index);
059        }
060        return d;
061    }
062
063    public int[][] getInts(CharSequence item)
064    {
065        int i = names.getInt(item);
066        int[][] d = null;
067        if(i >= 0 && i < intMaps.size())
068        {
069            d = intMaps.get(i);
070        }
071        return d;
072    }
073
074    public int[][] getInts(int index)
075    {
076        int[][] d = null;
077        if(index >= 0 && index < intMaps.size())
078        {
079            d = intMaps.get(index);
080        }
081        return d;
082    }
083
084    public double[][] getDoubles(CharSequence item)
085    {
086        int i = names.getInt(item);
087        double[][] d = null;
088        if(i >= 0 && i < charMaps.size())
089        {
090            d = doubleMaps.get(i);
091        }
092        return d;
093    }
094
095    public double[][] getDoubles(int index)
096    {
097        double[][] d = null;
098        if(index >= 0 && index < doubleMaps.size())
099        {
100            d = doubleMaps.get(index);
101        }
102        return d;
103    }
104
105    public float[][] getFloats(CharSequence item)
106    {
107        int i = names.getInt(item);
108        float[][] d = null;
109        if(i >= 0 && i < floatMaps.size())
110        {
111            d = floatMaps.get(i);
112        }
113        return d;
114    }
115
116    public float[][] getFloats(int index)
117    {
118        float[][] d = null;
119        if(index >= 0 && index < floatMaps.size())
120        {
121            d = floatMaps.get(index);
122        }
123        return d;
124    }
125
126    public int putChars(CharSequence name, char[][] item)
127    {
128        int i = names.getInt(name);
129        if(i < 0) {
130            i = names.size();
131            names.add(name);
132            charMaps.add(item);
133            intMaps.add(null);
134            doubleMaps.add(null);
135            floatMaps.add(null);
136        }
137        else
138        {
139            charMaps.set(i, item);
140            intMaps.set(i, null);
141            doubleMaps.set(i, null);
142            floatMaps.set(i, null);
143        }
144        return i;
145    }
146    public int putInts(CharSequence name, int[][] item)
147    {
148        int i = names.getInt(name);
149        if(i < 0) {
150            i = names.size();
151            names.add(name);
152            charMaps.add(null);
153            intMaps.add(item);
154            doubleMaps.add(null);
155            floatMaps.add(null);
156        }
157        else
158        {
159            charMaps.set(i, null);
160            intMaps.set(i, item);
161            doubleMaps.set(i, null);
162            floatMaps.set(i, null);
163        }
164        return i;
165    }
166    public int putDoubles(CharSequence name, double[][] item)
167    {
168        int i = names.getInt(name);
169        if(i < 0) {
170            i = names.size();
171            names.add(name);
172            charMaps.add(null);
173            intMaps.add(null);
174            doubleMaps.add(item);
175            floatMaps.add(null);
176        }
177        else
178        {
179            charMaps.set(i, null);
180            intMaps.set(i, null);
181            doubleMaps.set(i, item);
182            floatMaps.set(i, null);
183        }
184        return i;
185    }
186    public int putFloats(CharSequence name, float[][] item)
187    {
188        int i = names.getInt(name);
189        if(i < 0) {
190            i = names.size();
191            names.add(name);
192            charMaps.add(null);
193            intMaps.add(null);
194            doubleMaps.add(null);
195            floatMaps.add(item);
196        }
197        else
198        {
199            charMaps.set(i, null);
200            intMaps.set(i, null);
201            doubleMaps.set(i, null);
202            floatMaps.set(i, item);
203        }
204        return i;
205    }
206}
